pageContent.longDescription: Pizza Margherita is a typical Neapolitan pizza, made with tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, basil, salt, and extra-virgin olive oil.
The epic joining of two Italian inventions explodes with spectacular umami flavor, balanced here by the dreamy, delicate flavor of burrata, and the peppery zip of bright green arugula.
Chicago-style pizza usually refers to deep-dish pizza, which is a thick pizza baked in a pan and layered with cheese, fillings like meat and vegetables, and sauce
A foldable pizza with a crispy outer crust and baked in a wood burning oven
A thick cut of pizza with pillowy dough, a crunchy crust, and robust tomato sauce.
Pizza Margherita is a typical Neapolitan pizza, made with tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, basil, salt, and extra-virgin olive oil.
The epic joining of two Italian inventions explodes with spectacular umami flavor, balanced here by the dreamy, delicate flavor of burrata, and the peppery zip of bright green arugula.
Chicago-style pizza usually refers to deep-dish pizza, which is a thick pizza baked in a pan and layered with cheese, fillings like meat and vegetables, and sauce
A foldable pizza with a crispy outer crust and baked in a wood burning oven
A thick cut of pizza with pillowy dough, a crunchy crust, and robust tomato sauce.
